results.title: Courtesy, etiquette and attitude in the workplace
results.brief_description: Poor behaviour and practices of individuals in the workplace can impact on the group as a whole. The aim of this program is to identify inappropriate attitudes, behaviours and work habits and to introduce new measures which will improve the work ethic of an organisation. Critical issues addressed: bad manners; attitude; personal presentation; dealing with others and good manners. A training manual accompanies the program and may be borrowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: Country of Islam
results.creator_credit: Gunther V. Fritsch and Churchill-Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description: Provides a glimpse of the culture, economy and religion of Morocco as seen through the eyes of Mustafa, a Moslem boy who leaves his village home and journeys to a city to seek an education.

results.title: Counting the beat
results.creator_credit: Kimble Rendall, Sue Clothier and Mushroom Pictures
results.brief_description: Mushroom Records - founded by the charismatic Michael Gudinski, has proven to be one of the most influential independent Australian record labels. “Counting the beat” is a fascinating history of 25 years of Australian rock and roll, as well as tracing the label’s evolution - its birth with such seminal figures as Billy Thorpe and Chain, through the glitz and glamour of Skyhooks, the pop glory days of soap stars Kylie and Jason, the breakthrough of Paul Kelly, and international success with Nick Cave, Peter Andre and Garbage. Australian performers such as Kylie Minogue, Jimmy Barnes, Deborah Conway and Paul Kelly take this opportunity to discuss the evolution of their careers, their ups and downs through these intimate interviews are enlightening, as well as being interspersed with studio footage from their performances.

results.title: Couldn't be fairer
results.creator_credit: Dennis O'Rourke, British Broadcasting Corporation and O'Rourke and Associates Filmakers
results.brief_description: This is a devastating account of the Aboriginal land rights battle in Queensland. It reveals white Australians at their most beer-sodden and hypocritical. O’Rourke has captured scenes showing how racism and vulgarity, are alive and thriving in the Australian heartland! The film includes interviews by Mick Miller, chairman of the Queensland Aboriginal Land Council, with Joh Bjelke-Peterson and Russ Hinze.

results.title: Cotton in today's world
results.brief_description: Through scenes filmed in Egypt, India, Mexico, Indonesia and England, this film presents a brief historical background of the growing of cotton and indicates its important place in the economy of the world today. Modern American methods of growing, spraying, picking and ginning cotton are shown as well as some of the finished products.

results.title: Cotton growing and spinning: Dogon people, Mali Highlands
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation

results.title: Cotton goods
results.creator_credit: Eastman Teaching Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Shows the picking, ginning, bailing, and sale of cotton; the carding, twisting, and drawing of yarn; the production of thread; the weaving and testing of cotton fabrics; and some of the multiple uses of cotton in everyday life.

results.title: Cosi Fan Tutte [Australian Opera]
results.brief_description: Mozart’s classic comedy is performed at the Victorian Arts Centre, March 28, 1990 as part of the ‘Esso night at the opera’ series. Cast includes Yvonne Kenny, David Hobson, Fiona Janes, Jeffrey Black, Rosamund Illing and John Pringle. In Italian with English sub-titles, music conducted by Peter Robinson.

results.title: Cortege of Eagles (TEFC)
results.brief_description: One of a group of modern dances created by Martha Graham. A creative ballet representing her mature creative work. The story is set in Ancient Troy at the time of its fall. When Hecuba, portrayed by Martha Graham, is faced with the inevitable consequence of the violent times, she herself is driven to terrible violence. Music composed and conducted by Eugene Lester: setting by Isamu Noguchi.

results.title: Cork in Portugal
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the economic importance of cork production to Portugal and its people, and describes the role of the cork worker in a changing industry. Examines the way in which cork is harvested, processed and manufactured into a wide variety of products which are used all over the world.
